intro: Neurocalyx borneensis f. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy neurocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "pubescens." Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
